vulnerability_report.description: Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Deserialization of Untrusted Data when passing input through to the `remark-mdx` package, due to its default configurations that are missing input sanitization. Exploiting this vulnerability is possible when passing input in both `MDXProvider` and `remarkPlugins`.
Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) through the `next/image` component.
Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Resource Exhaustion via the `next/image` component.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via the Image Optimization API. In order for an instance to be affected by this issue, the `domains` option must be assigned to something other than the default, the instance is not affected by this vulnerability.
Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) when `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` is used.
Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) due to the `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` attribute.
Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) due to the `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` attribute.
This package is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) when using `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.
